title: Reunions can be turned into getaways at these sites
text:
Reunions can be turned into getaways at these sites Travel By Lynn O'Rourke Hayes THE DALLAS MORNING NEWS • Sunday August 2, 2015 5:00 AM 
Planning a family reunion? Here are five ideas to consider. 
• Otesaga Resort, Cooperstown, N.Y.: Sports-loving families can gather in the foothills of the Catskill Mountains in a town perhaps best-known for the National Baseball Hall of Fame. 
Check out the Farmer’s Museum and the Fenimore Art Museum, play golf, visit a cider mill and relax on the shores of Lake Otsego. 
Stay at the Otesaga Resort Hotel, where you can share stories around the pool and plan future adventures. 
Visit otesaga.com or thisiscooperstown.com . 
• JW Marriott Camelback Inn Resort & Spa, Scottsdale, Ariz.: Rich in history, this Sonoran Desert resort is nestled at the base of Paradise Valley’s Mummy Mountain. Stay in pueblo-style casitas, hang with the kids at the Jackrabbit Pool complex or hike in the nearby mountain preserve. 
Spa lovers can revive their spirits in the 32,000-square-foot spa, where indigenous plants and minerals are used to enhance well-being. Plan a family golf outing on the new Ambiente course. 
Visit camelbackspa.com or camelbackinn.com . 
• Rainbow Trout Ranch, Antonito, Colo.: Fly-fish on a private stretch of the Conejos River, hike in the San Juans and relax around an evening campfire. Saddle up as a clan and enjoy an amble through the pines, watch the youngsters make new friends in the kids’ camp or float on nearby white water. 
Stay in two- and three-bedroom cabins, where front porches provide stunning views and an ideal place to gather. 
Visit rainbowtroutranch.com 
• Stonewater Cove Resort, Shell Knob, Mo.: Who knows how to water-ski? Or wakeboard? Who wants to learn? 
Gather your gang on Table Rock Lake and learn a new sport. Home base is a resort surrounded by 500 forested foothills and ideal for an active clan eager to kayak, hike, bike, zip-line. And check out the spa before relaxing over board games in the lounge or in the hot tub overlooking the lake. 
Visit stonewatercove.com 
• South Seas Island Resort, Captiva Island, Fla.: Choose from hotel rooms, cottages and villas within 330 seaside acres on this former Key lime plantation. 
Engage in water sports, mangrove exploration, tennis, golf and bike riding or enjoy the 2-mile white sandy beach.
